BiblioEntry.Title: Multiple eigenspaces
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Multiple eigenspaces / Aleš Leonardis, Horst Bischof, Jasna Maver

BiblioSet.Title: Pattern recognition
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Pattern recognition
BiblioSet.Subtitle: the journal of the Pattern Recognition Society

BiblioEntry.Abstract: In this paper, we propose a novel self-organizing framework to construct multiple, low-dimensional eigenspaces from a set of training images. Grouping of images is systematically and robustly performed via eigenspace-growing in terms of low-dimensional eigenspaces. To further increas the robustness, the eigenspace-growing is initiated independently with many small groups of images - seeds. All this grown eigenspaces are treated as hypotheses that are subject to a selection procedure eigenspace-selection, based on the MDL principle, which selects the final resulting set of eingenspaces as an efficient procedure eigenspace-selection, based on the MDL principle, which selects the final resulting set of eigenspaces as an efficient representation of the training set, taking into account the number of images encompassed by the eigenspaces, the dimensions of eigenspaces, and their corresponding residual errors. We have tested the proposed method on a number of standard image sets, and the significance of the approach will respect to the recognition rate has been demonstrated.

BiblioEntry.Title: Recognizing 2-tone images in grey-level parametric eigenspaces
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Recognizing 2-tone images in grey-level parametric eigenspaces / Jasna Maver, Aleš Leonardis

BiblioSet.Title: Pattern recognition letters
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Pattern recognition letters
BiblioSet.Subtitle: an official publication of the International Association for Pattern Recognition

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Standard approaches to recognition using parametric eigenspaces have been designed under the assumption that the training images and the input images to be recognized are of the same type. In this paper we propose a novel approach which demonstrates that having an eigenspace encompassing a set of grey-level images, it is possible to recover the images of the objects in the training set. We present the recognition results of 2-tone images using the eigenspace built from a set of grey-level images.

BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Recognition of nonlinearly transformed input images in eigenspaces / Jasna Maver and Aleš Leonardis

AuthorGroup.CorpAuthor: Sixth Computer Vision Winter Wrokshop, Bled, Slovenia, February 7-9, 2001

BiblioSet.Title: Computer vision : proceedings
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Computer vision / Sixth Computer Vision Winter Workshop, Bled, Slovenia, February 7 - 9, 2001 / Boštjan Likar (ed.)
BiblioSet.Subtitle: proceedings

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Standard approaches to recognition using parametric eigenspaces have been designed under the assumption that the training images and the input images to be recognised are the same type. In this paper we propose a novel approach which demonstrates that having an eigenspace encompassing a set of grey-level images, it is possible to recover the eigenspace coefficients (and consequently recognize the input images) even in the cases when the input images are 2-tone or edge images of the objects in the training set. We present the recognition results of 2-tone and edge images using the same eigenspace built form a set of grey-level images.
